text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;">While the four tendered witnesses were produced before the learned trial Court by the prosecution the learned Public Prosecutor/ Assistant Public Prosecutor ought to have drawn the attention of the four tendered witnesses to their statements and evidence recorded by the learned Magistrate, 2nd Class and thereby the prosecution has failed to comply with the provisions of section 135 of the Evidence Act. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em>Abul Kalam &amp; others vs State 5 BLC 270.</em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"> </strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong>Section </strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;">137</strong>—</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;">When a prosecution witness does not mention about a particular accused in his examination-in-chief, generally, no question is asked about him in cross-examination. In the instant case, surprisingly the defence took the risk and obtained prompt and ready answer from the PWs 7 to 9 that they did not see any of the condemned prisoners committing the offence which was rightly disbelieved by the trial Court. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em>State vs Md Joynal Abedin and others 5 BLC 672.</em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong>Section </strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;">137</strong>—</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;">As there was no challenge in cross-examination about the threat of murder and the arrest of appellant was after absconsion it is proved that the appellant had threatened the victim with murder and he absconded after the occurrence till his arrest. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em>Mostafa (Md) vs State 1 BLC 82.</em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><em> </em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong>Section </strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;">137</strong>—</span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;">The seizure list witnesses were declared hostile and the prosecution <span style="color: black;">cross-examined them but the PWs 1 and 5 have proved that the appellants were apprehended from the truck at about midnight along with the contraband articles but the defence failed to challenge such facts and the seized articles were of Indian origin and as such there is nothing to disbelieve the prosecution case. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Hasanuzzaman and others vs State 1 BLC 219.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Sections 137 &amp; 139</span></strong><span style="color: black;">— </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Any finding based on the examination-in-chief of a witness ignoring his cross-examination and vital circumstances surrounding the case must be held to be no proper finding in th eye of law. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Tamal Biswas vs State 5 BLC 398.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 145</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">As the PWs 2 to 5 were not cross-examined as to their previous statements made before the Magistrate as required under section 145, Evidence Act, such statements are inadmissible. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Yahiya alias Thandu &amp; ors 1 BLC 185.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 145</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">A witness may be cross-examined as to previous statements made by him in writing or reduced into writing, and relevant to matters in question, without such writing being shown to him, or being proved; but if it is intended to contradict him by the writing, his attention must, before the writing can be proved, be called to those parts of it which are to be used for the purpose of contradicting him. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Fazlu alias Md Fazlur Rahman and others vs State 1 BLC 558</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 145</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">As the eye-witness Nos. 4 and 5 omitted to state the vital part of the occurrence to IO and the PWs 6 and 7 were not examined by IO and the PWs 4 and 5 did</span> <span style="color: black;">not state to IO that they had told the occurrence to PWs 1, 6 and 7 which create doubt about the prosecution case and such testimony of the ocular witnesses cannot be relied upon as there was omission on vital points and contradiction in their testimony. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Alam Howlader and others vs State, represented by the Deputy Commissioner 3.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 145 </span></strong><span style="color: black;">— </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Before lodging the First Information Report the informant talked to PW 8 who also accompanied the informant to the police station but the condemned prisoner having not been named in the First Information Report the deposition of PW 8 in Court stating the condemned prisoner as assailant of Kashem when in the First Information Report he was only suspected which is a departure from the First Information Report story and as it is embellishment cannot be accepted in this case for awarding death sentence when the evidence on record both oral and documentary, create doubt about the prosecution case and hence the condemned prisoner is entitled to get benefit of doubt and accordingly he was acquitted. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Hasen Ali 4 BLC 582</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 145 </span></strong><span style="color: black;">— </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">PW 1 has deposed in Court that the accused persons after entering the house demanded money from his bhabi who gave Taka 7,000.00 to them and after his brother was taken away by the accused persons she raised hue and cry and on hearing the same the witnesses came, and that the PW 2 has deposed in Court that on the night of occurrence he saw that 8 to 10 persons were </span><span style="color: black;">coming and on his query and focussing the torch light he had been threatened by those persons, and that the PW 5 has said in court as an eye-witness that her husband was taken away in her presence and the accused persons after entering the house demanded money from her and on her denial she was told that they had money from the sale proceeds of cattle and on her showing the money the accused persons had taken away the same, and that the PW 3 has stated in court that on hearing hue and cry he went to the house accompanied by others and searched the victim who was found in the paddy field and when he was coming back from the field he met with the informant and all these vital facts were not stated to the Investigating Officer and in view of such omissions the evidence of the above witnesses cannot be accepted as all these omissions amount to contradiction. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Babu Mollah and ors vs State 4 BLC 559</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Sections 145 and </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">157</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">When the FIR says that accused Ramzan Nessa brought a dao from the dwelling hut and gave it to the condemned prisoner but the informant as PW 1 says in Court that the dao was brought by the condemned prisoner Firoj himself and the PWs 3, 7 and 9 although deposed in Court that Ramzan Nessa supplied the dao to Firoj but they did not state the same to Investigating Officer while they were examined under section 161, CrPC and in such circumstances their evidence on this point was discarded. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Firoj Miah and another 5 BLC 1.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Sections 145 and </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">157</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">There is no con­tradiction or discrepancies in the statements</span> <span style="color: black;">of the eye-witnesses namely, PWs 1 to 3, regarding taking away the victim from his house and of Jahangir's giving blow and Habib Mallik's giving chora blow in his chest and the victim lying dead on the C &amp; B road have been made in the FIR and there is no omission of these vital facts in the FIR. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Jahangir Howlader and another vs State 3 BLC 164</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Sections 145 and </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">157</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">There are many contradictions in the evidence of the PWs and that absence of sign of rape in the medical report and non-examination of the wearing clothes made the whole case most doubtful one for which the appellant is not found guilty of the charge brought against him under section 6(1) of the Nari-o-Shishu Nirjatan (Bishes Bidhan) Ain, 1995. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Seraj Talukder vs State 3 BLC 182.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 154</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">When a witness is cross-examined by party calling him the whole evidence is to be taken into consideration. As the evidence of hostile witnesses has corroborated the evidence of the other PWs the foundation of prosecution case is shaken and destroyed. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Fazlul Haq Sikder vs State 1 BLC 173.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 154</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Merely because the evidence of a witness has been declared hostile his evidence cannot be brushed aside as his evidence is to be considered for what it is worth and his evidence cannot be treated as unreliable so as to exclude his evidence from considering altogether. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Abdur Rab alias Nedon Miah vs State 1 BLC 270</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Sections 154 and 155</span></strong><strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;"> </span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">Since the prosecution has failed to show any hostile </span><span style="color: black;">animus with the prosecution, mere declaration of some of the seizure list witnesses and first information report named witnesses hostile in no way cured the defect of the prosecution case and the prosecution has hopelessly failed to prove the recovery of the incriminating articles and hence the persistent evidence of the public witnesses regarding denial of their presence at the alleged recovery in no way can be cured by the official witnesses (police personnel) who are none but interested in this case and in the result the order of conviction and sentence is set aide. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Aslam Jahangir vs State 5 BLC 514.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 155</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">The PW 14 who is a rickshaw puller cannot be said to be a chance witness as he was waiting for passenger at the gate of Hotel Gulshan and therefore, his presence at the place of occurrence was not by chance, but due to his profession. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs AKM Gousuddin alias MP Gous &amp; others 3 BLC 536</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 155</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Although there are some minor discrepancies in the evidence of PWs. and the PWs 1-4 are close relations of the victim as well as of the informant but mere relationship cannot be a ground to disbelieve or discard their evidences and cannot be treated as unworthy of credit. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Ranjit Kumar Mallik 2 BLC 211.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">157</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Upon a scrutiny it appears that the evidence of PWs are full of contradictions, inconsistencies and omissions and that there is a departure from the fact as stated in the written ejahar, for which it is difficult to believe such inconsistent evidence of PWs who are related to one another. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Pear</span></em></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"> <em><span style="color: black;">All Khan alias Pear Ali vs State, represented by the Deputy Commissioner 3 BLC 555.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 165</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Considering the statement made under section 164, CrPC by Anjali Rani and on a close scrutiny and analysis of the evidence and the materials on record it transpires that the prosecution signally failed to bring home the charge against the respondents of kidnapping or abducting the victim girl. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Haren Haider vs MdAkkas Ali &amp; ors 3 BLC 455.</span></em></strong></span></p></div></div>
785	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">Evidence Act, 1872 (Part-1)</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p><b>Citation:</b>   5 BLC 278, 1 BLC 325, 1 BLC 582, 4 BLC 261, 4 BLC 545, 2 BLC 630, 4 BLC 559, 5 BLC (AD) 41, 5 BLC 197, 5 BLC 248, 5 BLC 332, 5 BLC 304, 2 BLC 465, 1 BLC 185, 1 BLC 421, 3 BLC 56, 3 BLC 536, 3 BLC 555, 2 BLC 249,  2 BLC 211, 5 BLC 210, 5 BLC 126, 5 BLC 3</p><p><b>Case Year:</b>  1872</p><p><b>Subject:</b>  Evidence mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 14pt; color: black;">Evidence Act, 1872</span></strong></span></p><p align="center" class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: center; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; color: black;">[I of 1872]</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;"> </span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">3</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">There is complete chain of circumstances that the appellants assaulted deceased victim Biswajit severely and dealt fatal blows causing his death when appellant Gulzar participated in the occurrence most actively and he was found by PW 4 for the last time with the deceased victim when Gulzar was chasing by the eastern side of the khal and the circumstances of the case taken cumulatively are forming a chain so complete that there is no escape from the conclusion that the murder of victim Biswajit was committed by the accused appellant Gulzar and his associates and none else. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Gulzar Biswas and others vs State 5 BLC 278.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 3</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">As the prosecution has failed to prove the motive to commit the heinous offence murder it cannot be said that the six accused persons or all the fourteen inmates of </span><span style="color: black;">the house are jointly liable for the murder. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Zahirul Alam Kamal and another vs State 1 BLC 325.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">3</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">As the prosecution has failed to prove his case either by direct evidence or by indirect evidence or by any other circumstantial evidence in fixing liability for causing murder of Chapa by a particular inmate or inmates of the house, it is difficult to maintain the conviction and sentence and, as such, the convicts-appellants are entitled to acquittal on the ground of benefit of doubt. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Zahirul Alam Kamal and another vs State 1 BLC 325.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 3</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">As the evidence adduced by the prosecution being of a circumstantial nature and there being a missing link in the chain of circumstances, the prosecution failed to prove the guilt of the appellants beyond reasonable doubt for which the appellants are given the benefit of doubt. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Nuru and another vs State 1 BLC 582.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"> </strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">3</span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">—Last seen</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">If the evidence of PWs 1 and 2 are read along with the evidence of PW 5 it is found that the victim Seru Mia was last found in the company of the accused persons including the appellant Md Salim which amply proves strong circumstantial evidence pointing to the guilt of the accused persons for committing the offence of kidnapping of the victim and as such they are guilty of the offence under section 364 of the Penal Code. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Md Selim vs State 4 BLC 261</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">3</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">When the vital piece of information regarding the condemned prisoner was seen standing and then carrying the victim girl on his shoulder on the bank of</span> <span style="color: black;">the river was not mentioned in the First Information Report lodged by PW 1,13 days after the incident which belies the evidence of PW 3 regarding happening of such incident and hence the evidence of PWs 1, 3, 4, 5, 8, 9 and 15 cannot be relied on and hence the prosecution has failed to prove the charge against the condemned prisoner beyond reasonable doubt and as such he is entitled to get benefit of doubt and is acquitted. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Syed Habibur Rahman &amp; Rocket 4 BLC 545.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 3</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">As the prosecutrix did not sustain any injury on her face, cheeks or breasts at the time of commission of the alleged rape and the Medical Board also did not detect any trace of sexual violence on the two victims the offence under section 376 of the Penal Code is not proved beyond all reasonable doubt for which the appellants are entitled to get benefit of doubt. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Abdul Aziz (Md) and another vs State 2 BLC 630</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Sections </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">3</span></strong><span style="color: black;"> <strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;">&amp;</strong> <strong>8</strong></span><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Admitted enmity between the parties and the absence of corroboration of the evidence of the interested witnesses do not inspire confidence that the prosecution has proved its case beyond any shadow of doubt. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Babu Mollah and ors vs State 4 BLC 559</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">5</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">The evidence of eye­witnesses cannot be discarded on the ground that they are interested witnesses and such evidence is admissible in evidence if they are found to be truthful witnesses and telling the truth. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Ful Mia 5 BLC (AD) 41</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">5</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">Although PWs 1, 2 and 4 are relations and interested witnesses but near relationship is not enough to discard their </span><span style="color: black;">testimonies unless there is some internal marks of falsehood in their testimonies. Considering their testimonies it appears that they do not suffer from any defect but the rule of prudence requires corroboration of such evidence where bitter enmity is admitted between the parties when neutral and independent witnesses namely, the PWs 3, 9, 10, 13, 15, 16 and 21 have corroborated them. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Babul Mia and 2 others vs State 5 BLC 197.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">5</span></em></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">When all the PWs being police persons and members of the police force are not disinterested witnesses as they are interested in the result of the case where corroboration on some facts with one another, if any, cannot be accepted as independent corroboration as required under law to prove the charge beyond doubt when no independent impartial disinterested neighbour witnesses as required under section 103 of the Code of Criminal Procedure could be examined to prove the recovery and seizure list and also to prove the charge beyond reasonable doubt, the prosecution has miserably failed to prove beyond all reasonable doubt the recovery and seizure of the seized articles from the actual possession and control of the convict appellants who are entitled to get benefit of doubt and also are entitled to get acquitted. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Jewel and another vs State 5 BLC 248.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Sections </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">5 <span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">and </span>24</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">In view of the confessional statement coupled with circumstantial evidence and the evidence of the PWs the prosecution has proved the case of committing double murder by the</span> <span style="color: black;">condemned prisoner which she did intentionally and such intention is apparent from the nature of the injuries proved by PWs 9 and 10 and hence the accused has rightly been convicted under section 302 of the Penal Code by the trial Court. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Romana Begum &amp; Nomi 5 BLC 332.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Sections </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">5</span></strong><span style="color: black;"> <strong>and 24</strong></span><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Unretracted inculpa­tory confessional statement giving a true account of the prosecution case, excepting the allegation of attempt to commit rape on the minor girl but admitting removing the salwar of the minor girl and killing her by throttling, and rape was committed on the victim girl before she was strangulated as testified by the doctor who held post-mortem examination coupled with extra-judicial confession made in presence of the witnesses on the night of occurrence before arrival of the police is relevant and admissible in evidence when both confessional statement and extra-judicial confession are voluntary and true supporting the prosecution case can form the basis of conviction. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Azad Miah &amp; Md Azad 5 BLC 304.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 6</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">What a witness heard from the crowd cannot be the substantive evidence and it can only be used as corroborative evidence, if there is substantive evidence in this respect. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt;
