text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Ashu and 3 others vs State 2 BLC 465.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Sections 6 &amp; </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">7</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">Evidence of the doctor and the two nurses as to the request of stomach-wash made by the persons who brought the deceased to the hospital are admissible in evidence as <em>res gestae </em>and sections 6 and 7, Evidence Act allow it as an </span><span style="color: black;">exception to hearsay rule. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Yahiya alias Thandu &amp; ors 1 BLC 185.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 8</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Although the trial Court convicted the appellant only on the ground of his absconsion but mere absconsion cannot always be a circumstance to lead an inference of guilt of the accused as sometimes out of fear, self-respect and to avoid unnecessary harassment even an innocent person remains absconding. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Munsurul Hossain vs State 1 BLC 421</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 8</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Subsequent conduct may be considered along with other evidence but it cannot be accepted as ground for awarding conviction in a murder case. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Zahirul Alain Kamal and another vs State 1 BLC 325</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 8</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Absconding by itself is not conclusive either of guilt or of guilty conscience. The fact that the accused absconded soon after the crime was committed is no evidence by itself and it may only lend weight to other evidence. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Mashuque alias Masauq Ullah vs State 1 BLC 539</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 8</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Mere suspicion or absconsion does not prove the prosecution case against any particular accused. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Hasen Ali 4 BLC 582.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 8</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">The prosecution is not bound to prove the motive of the accused persons for committing the crime, for motive is not an ingredient of the offence and if the evidence connecting the accused persons with the crime is unimpeachable in character, they may be held guilty even without proof of their motive. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Babul Mia and 2 others vs State 5 BLC 197.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 8</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">The husband wanted to sell 4 ducks belonging to the wife which she kept at her paternal house and on her refusal there was a quarrel between them and the husband assaulted her and also throttled her to death which appears to be the motive for the murder has been well proved. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Fazer PL (Md) alias Fazer Ali vs State 5 BLC 542.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 8</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Although the prosecution is not bound to prove the motive of killing in every case but when any motive is suggested it becomes the duty of the prosecution to prove the same. In the instant case the prosecution has not been able to prove the motive suggested by them. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Sarowaruddin 5 BLC 451.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">8</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">In a criminal case no motive is necessary for proving the prosecution case. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Hemayet Khan and others 3 BLC 56.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 8</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">As the condemned prisoner, Gous absconded soon after the occurrence and still he is absconding attracting the provision of illustration (1) of section 8 of the Evidence Act for proving the prosecution case of strong circumstantial evidence of absconsion besides the ocular evidence. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs AKM Gousuddin alias MP Gous &amp; others 3 BLC 536.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 8</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">The conviction of appellant Golam Hossain Pinto as solely based on his absconsion cannot be sustained without corroborative evidence. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Pear Ali Khan alias Pear Ali vs State, represented by the Deputy Commissioner 3 BLC 555.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 8</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">As there have been sheer enmity, hatred and litigation for three </span><span style="color: black;">generations between the parties which might have implicated the accused Madris in the case of murder and the old man or leader is often implicated now a days when he possibly is incapable of doing overt act for which he is entitled to get benefit of doubt. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Madris Miah and others vs State 2 BLC 249.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 8</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Mere absconsion of an accused without any corroborative evidence as to the offence alleged to have been committed cannot be the basis of conviction for which the appellant is entitled to be acquitted. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Sanaullah vs State 2 BLC 544.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Sections 8, 9 and 134</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">As the solitary eye-witness PW 3 who is found to be fully trustworthy and reliable and bing corroborated by PWs 1-2 and 4-7 and the strong circumstances arising out of the conduct of the condemned-accused for his attempt of running away from his house and the place of occurrence and his long continuous absconsion during trial and even thereafter which has proved the charge of murder beyond all reasonable doubt. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Ranjit Kumar Mallik 2 BLC 211.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Sections 8, 24 and </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">27</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">Relying on the inculpatory confessional statement of the condemned prisoner which is found to be true and voluntary and which finds supports from the evidence of the PWs 1, 2 and 6 and also the recovery of the dead bodies of the deceased on the basis of his extra judicial confession can safely be considered and on that basis his conviction can be maintained when the conduct of the condemned prisoner in not taking any information and steps regarding the missing of his full sister and</span> <span style="color: black;">nephew is a relevant fact to show the conduct of the accused in this regard. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Jashimuddin &amp; Jaju Mia 5 BLC 210.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Sections 8, 43 and </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">145</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">The PWs 4 &amp; 5 contradict each other on material particulars when admittedly the appellant and others are close relations of the victim and other PWs. and admittedly there were litigations and disputes over landed properties when the star accused Kamrul Islam was acquitted by a Bench of the High Court Division disbelieving the prosecution story and there is nothing to disagree with the assessment of evidence and finding reached therein and hence the impugned judgment of conviction and sentence is not sustainable in law. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Liton vs State 5 BLC 126</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Sections 8 and 105</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">The circumstances are not capable of any other explanation or hypothesis other than the guilt of the husband who is responsible for killing his wife as he failed to explain the reasons for the death of his wife and accordingly the accused husband is found guilty under section 302 of the Penal Code and convicted thereunder and sentenced to suffer imprisonment for life. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Eunus Khan 5 BLC 353</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Sections 8 and 105</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—<strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;">Motive—Circums­tantial evidence</strong>—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">When the wife of convict appellant died with marks of injuries where her husband and minor children were present but the husband neither informed the police nor did he give any explanation as to the cause of her death and the facts and circumstances are such that the death could </span><span style="color: black;">not be caused by any other person except the husband and in such circumstances motive is not necessary. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Farid Ali vs State 4 BLC 27.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 12pt;"> </span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Sections 8 and 106</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">The prosecution having proved the presence of the convict husband at the place of occurrence house on the night of occurrence, husband of the deceased owes an explanation as to how his wife met her death at his house. Neither the husband called in a physician for treatment of his wife nor did he inform his father-in-law nor any other near relations regarding the occurrence nor was he present at the time of burial of the deceased, he remained absconded even after the delivery of judgment without any cogent explanation is a relevant fact under section 8 of the Evidence Act. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Fazer Pk. (Md) alias Fazer AH vs State 5 BLC 542</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 9</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">As the test identification parade was held after about 3 months of the arrest of the accused person and the police officer was present at the scene which diminish the evidentiary value of the test. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Md Musa alias Mussaiya alias Shafir Bap 1 BLC 467.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Sections 9 and </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">157</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">All the T<strong>I </strong>parades were held after about one year from the date of occurrence and there was a chance for PW.l to see the accused persons in court lockup before the identification in the TI parade for which no reliance can be placed on such TI parade and hence the conviction and sentence under section 395 of the Penal Code is not sustainable. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Mirza Abdul Hakim and others vs State 5 BLC (AD) 21</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">24</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Confessional statement of condemned prisoner was recorded on 27-4-89 and he did not retract it from judicial custody but he retracted his judicial confession on 17-5-89 by filing a typed written petition wherein he failed to state that who had murdered his wife and under what circumstances it had happened, even it did not disclose the story of alleged abduction of his wife by miscreants and her eventual murder by them as alleged in the written statement and such retracted confession can solely form the basis of conviction if it is found voluntary and true. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Munir and another 1 BLC 345</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 24</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—<strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;">Inculpatory part of the confession is separable from its exculpatory part</strong>—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">The inculpatory part of the confession should be placed together with the other evidence to come to the conclusion in respect of the confessing accused person rejecting the exculpatory part of the confession which is inconsistent with the evidence accepting that part of confession which is consistent with the evidence on record. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Hemayet Khan and others 3 BLC 56</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 24</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Although the appellant Hemayet admits in his confessional statement to have kidnapped Belial from his father's house but he was arrested on 12-9-93 and his confessional statement was recorded on 23-9-93 for which no reliance can be placed on such confessional statement. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Hemayet Khan &amp; others 3 BLC 56.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 24</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">Both the appellants were not assured by the recording Magistrate that whether they made any confessional </span><span style="color: black;">statements or not they would not be sent back to the police custody but instead they would be sent to the judicial custody and ultimately they were sent to the police custody when the evidence of PWs. 5 and 6 shows that the confessing accused persons were assaulted by the police which comprehensively prove that the confessional statements were the products of torture, intimidation and fear having no evidentiary value. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Nil Ratan Biswas and others vs State 3 BLC 35</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 24</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—<strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;">Retracted confession</strong>— </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">When confessional statement was recorded taking the condemned prisoner into prolonged police custody such confessional statement was neither voluntary nor true and the belated retraction of such confession will not presume her guilt as no legal assistance was available to the condemned prisoner till the appointment of an Advocate by the State. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Bilkis Ara Begum vs State 4 BLC 386.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"> </strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 24</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—<strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;">Extra-judicial confession</strong>— </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">The PWs 7, 9 and 11 having failed to state the exact words of extra judicial confession as alleged to have been made by condemned prisoner cannot be relied upon in the absence of exact words used by the accused person getting aid of corroborative circumstantial evidence. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Hasen Ali 4 BLC 582</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 24</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—<strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;">Absence of printed form— Confession is admissible</strong>—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">Mere absence of printed form in recording the confessional statement made by the accused cannot make it inadmissible in evidence when in recording such confessional statement on a plain piece of paper the Magistrate observed all the formalities as required under section 164(3) </span><span style="color: black;">of the Code of Criminal Procedure. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Abul Kalam Mollah vs State 4 BLC 470</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 24</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">When the confession becomes doubtful the conviction and sentence based solely on such confession cannot be sustained in law. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Masum Howlader alias Masum vs State </span></em></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">2 <em>BLC 173</em></span></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 24</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—<strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;">Confessional statements— Corroboration of—Exculpatory and Inculpatory</strong>—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Besides the ocular evidence the belated-retracted confessional statement of convict Monsur Ali Khan supports the prosecution case which was also supported by the evidence of the doctor and his confessional statement is true and voluntary and was not obtained by torture, coercion or inducement for which his conviction is sustainable but the confessional statements of other two convicts are exculpatory in nature and in the absence of any evidence against them their conviction is not sustainable. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Aktar Hossain alias Aktar vs State 2 BLC 273.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">24</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">The police having violated the provision of section 167, CrPC in not producing the appellants before any competent Magistrate within 24 hours of their arrest and kept them in police custody for about 2 (two) days without any legal authority, that is without a necessary permission from the Magistrate under section 167, CrPC and such custody of the appellants is illegal resulting thereby the confessional statements are not voluntary and true. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Sarowaruddin 5 BLC 451.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Sections 24 and 30</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">Before recording the confessional statements of convict Jamila </span><span style="color: black;">Khatun and condemned prisoner AH Hossain by the Magistrate, they were detained by the police for two days and seven days respectively when it becomes the bounden duty of the recording Magistrate to try to ascertain whether there was any manner of police torture and to assure them that they would not be sent back to police custody whether they made any confession or not which having not been done by the recording Magistrate the confessional statements cannot be treated as voluntary and true and it cannot be used against them nor against other co-accused. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Ali Hossain and others 4 BLC 43</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">27</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"> </p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">Statement of accused in police custody leading to the discovery of heroin from the two rooms of two hotels is admissible in evidence under section 27 of the Evidence Act. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Raja Abdul Majib and others 1 BLC 144.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">27</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">While the accused person was in police custody he led the police and pointed out the place where he threw the trouser and underwear which is admissible under section 27 of the Evidence Act as that led to the discovery of accused person's blood and mud-stained trouser and underwear which unerringly indicated that the accused had committed the murder of his wife. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Munir and another 1 BLC 345</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">27</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">The recovery of other wearing apparels and toiletries of the deceased at the showing of the condemned-prisoner while in police custody leads to the irresistible conclusion that the condemned-prisoner had the most intimate relationship</span> <span style="color: black;">with the deceased and that wearing apparels and toiletries of the deceased must have been either in the possession of the condemned-prisoner or within his knowledge as to where those articles were. These recoveries are admissible in evidence under section 27 of the Evidence Act. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph;
