mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 14pt; color: black;">Nari-o-Shishu Nirjatan </span></strong></span></p><p align="center" class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: center; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 14pt; color: black;">(Bishes Bidhan)Ain, 1995 </span></strong></span></p><p align="center" class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: center; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; color: black;">[xvni of 1995]</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;"> </span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section</span></strong> <strong><span style="color: black;">6(1)</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">There are many</span> <span style="color: black;">contradictions and that absence of sign of rape in the medical report and non-examination of the wearing clothes made the whole case most doubtful one for which the appellant is not found guilty of the offence brought against him. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Seraj Talukder vs State 3 BLC 182.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">6(2)</span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">—</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;"> </span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Strong circumstantial evidence that leaving the minor girl to the company of the accused to take her to her house leading to the irresistible conclusion that the accused after committing rape on the minor girl caused her death by strangulation. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Azad Miah &amp; Md Azad 5 BLC 304</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">6(2)</span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">—</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;"> </span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">As only death sentence has been prescribed for the offence under section 6(2) of the Nari-o-Shishu Nirjatan (Bishesh Bidhan) Ain, 1995 and when the offence under such section is proved there is no scope for awarding a lesser sentence on any ground. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Azad Miah </span></em></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">&amp; <em>MdAzad 5 BLC 304.</em></span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">6(2)</span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">—</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;"> </span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">The prosecution has proved the case against the accused beyond reasonable doubt and the trial Court has rightly found him guilty under section 6(2) of the said Ain. As no alternative sentence is prescribed in section 6(2) of the said Ain there is no scope of exercising the power of discretion of the Court in awarding alternative sentence except the extreme punishment of death. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Rahim Sikder 5 BLC 466</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">6 (3)</span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">—</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;"> </span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">A 14 years old girl being an informant deposed in Court that she was raped by the appellants when there was no enmity between the parties and the two other neutral witnesses who stated that the victim girl came running near the shop of witness Ashraf without any pajama on her body and all other local witnesses corroborated this fact which manifestly proved that the informant was raped by the appellants in spite of contrary evidence of doctor. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Badal and 1 another vs State, represented by the Deputy Commissioner 4 BLC 381.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">6(3)</span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">—</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;"> </span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">While considering the police report (FRT) the Special Tribunal heard the learned Advocates of the parties and on perusal of the record and case diary took cognizance, of the offence after </span><span style="color: black;">observing that a <em>prima facie </em>case was made out by the prosecution but the Tribunal could not agree with the opinion of the IO and took cognizance on the basis of the materials on record. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Bikish Miah vs State 3 BLC (AD) 182</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Sections </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">6(3) <span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">and </span>14</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">The husband, Saiful Islam might not have actively participated in the commission of gang rape crime but it was within his prior knowledge and only his resistance or even protest or at least timely intimation to others could have saved her honour and life. Since there was no definite evidence that he instigated the murder of his wife, the offence of the condemned prisoner, the husband does not come within section 6(4) read with section 14 of the Act but comes within section 6(3) read with section 14 of the Act, after considering his confessional statement and the attendant circumstances. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Md Joynal Abedin and others 5 BLC 672.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">6(4) <span style="mso-bidi-font-weight: bold;">and </span>25</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">The evidence adduced by the prosecution against the five condemned prisoners is not only defective and deficient, but as a matter of fact, virtually there was no evidence against any of the condemned prisoners and the prosecution totally failed to prove the charge under section 6(4) of the said Ain and as such they are entitled to be acquitted. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Md Joynal Abedin and others 5 BLC 672.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 9(b)</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">In a case of carnal offence the prosecutrix must be believed but it is the rarest of rare cases when the prosecutrix can be disbelieved on the face of quality of the other evidences necessitating corroborative</span> <span style="color: black;">evidence which is wanting in the present case. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Akhter Hossain and others vs State 4 BLC 236</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 10(1)</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Since there is evidence of killing of the wife of the accused, lodging ejahar under section 302 of the Penal Code, submission of charge sheet under section 302 of the Penal Code and there is no cogent evidence as to the demand of dowry by the accused, no evidence to prove immediate cause of committing the offence, no cogent evidence as to committing the murder for dowry and no evidence as to the real cause of killing of the wife by the husband, the case does not come under section 10(1) of the Nari-o-Shishu Nirjatan Daman (Bishesh Bidhan) Ain, 1995 but it comes under section 302 of the Penal Code when the accused is responsible for causing death of his wife. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Abul Kalam 5 BLC 230</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">10(1)</span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">—</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;"> </span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">The condemned husbad was convicted under section 10(1) of the Nari-o-Shishu Nirjatan (Bishes Bidhan) Ain, 1995 and sentenced to death by the Nari-o-Shishu Nirjaton (Bishes Bidhan) Adalat but it appears from the evidence on record that charge under section 10(1) of the Ain of 1995 was not proved when the High Court Division relying upon an unreported decision of the Appellate Division without sending the case for trial afresh considered the case on merit in the interest of justice and it was found that on the date of occurrence at about 3-30 hours the husband of the victim carried her by a boat to her parents' house in serious injured condition. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Eunus Khan 5 BLC 353.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><em><span style="color: black;"> </span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">10(2)</span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">—</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;"> </span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">The alleged beating demanding dowry having not been proved by adducing any corroborating witness, the alleged occurrence does not come within the ambit of section 10(2) of Nari-o-Shishu Nirjatan Ain, 1995. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Shakhawat Hossain vs State 3 BLC 112.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 12pt;"> </span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">24</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—<strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;">Bail</strong>—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">It is contended that a false case has been filed against the appellant out of enmity with the informant and the appellant has been in custody since 4-7-1996 and the trial Court has failed to conclude the trial within the period of 120 days as fixed by section 20 of the Act. It is held that as the case is now under trial and it is likely to be completed within a very short time and the gravity of the offence deserves not to enlarge the petitioner on bail but a direction was given to grant bail to the appellant if the trial is not concluded within a period of 3 months from this day. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Rashid Khan, son of Dildar Hossain alias Dilbar Hossain vs State 2 BLC 580.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 12pt;"> </span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">24</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Nari-o-Shishu Nirjatan Daman Bishes Adalat, upon an application, cannot release the respondent No. 1 from safe custody disrespecting the findings of the High Court Division. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Asgar Ali vs Anjuman Ara Mukta and another 5 BLC 363.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 12pt;"> </span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">24</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">It appears that charge was framed on 27-4-97 against the appellant and his mother but not a single witness appeared in the Court and although the informant appeared in Court on several occasions but has not yet been examined as PW 1 which made it a case of deliberate attempt to delay the conclusion of the trial and hence the</span> <span style="color: black;">appellant is entitled to get the benefit of section 339C, CrPC and he is entitled to be released on bail. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Sohel vs State </span></em></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">5 <em>BLC 658</em></span></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 24</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">In a pending appeal where sentence is imprisonment for life the appellant was enlarged on bail as the victim girl was aged about 18 years and she had embraced Islam and married the appellant. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Ripon Farazi vs State 4 BLC 192.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 12pt;"> </span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 24</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">The record shows that the charge was framed on 27-4-97 against the appellant and another but surprisingly not even a single witness appeared in Court till today although the informant appeared in Court on several occasions praying for cancellation of bail of accused Shamsunnahar which is a deliberate attempt to delay the conclusion of the trial when the Court adjourned the trial on every fixed date with a direction to issue summons or warrant of witnesses when the trial under the present law should not be delayed in the manner as has been done in this case keeping the accused person in hajat for an indefinite period when the section 339C CrPC applies for the purpose of bail, the appellant is entitled to be released on bail. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Sohel vs State </span></em></strong></span><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">5 <em>BLC 658</em></span></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">4 BLC 622.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 29</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">From the savings clause in section 29(2)(3) of the Nari-o-Shishu Nirjatan (Bishes Bidhan) Ain, 1995 there is nothing in the language from which it can be concluded that only the cases pending for trial before any Special Tribunal or pending investigation under the Cruelty to Women (Deterrent Punishment) Ordinance, 1983 in its restricted meaning have been saved. If such restricted interpretation is accepted then </span><span style="color: black;">the accused persons who have committed offence under such repealed enactment will get premium without facing trial which could not be intention of the legislature. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Abul Kalam Khan vs Reaz Morshed and another 5 BLC 528.</span></em></strong></span></p></div></div>
800	<h2 class="blog_entry-title">Negotiable Instruments Act, 1881</h2>
<div class="entry-content"><div class="entry-content"><p><b>Citation:</b>  4 BLC (AD) 106</p><p><b>Case Year:</b>  1881</p><p><b>Subject:</b>  Negotiable Instruments </p><p><b>Delivery Date:</b> 1881</span></strong></span></p><p align="center" class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: center; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">138</span></strong><span style="color: black;"> <strong>and 141</strong></span><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">The cause of action for prosecution will arise under clause (c) of the proviso to section 138 of the Negotiable Instruments Act on the failure of the appellant to pay the amount within 15 days of the receipt of the notice of the complainant. In the present case, the cause of action arose on 19-1-96 and the petition of complaint was required to be filed within one month from 19-1-96 in compliance with clause (b) of section 141 of the Act which having not been done by the complainant the cognizance of the offence cannot be taken upon such complaint and hence the impugned proceeding is quashed. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">SM Anwar Hossain vs ShafiuL Alam (Chand) &amp; another 4 BLC (AD) 106.</span></em></strong></span></p></div></div>

style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">The Labour Court took cognizance of offence under section 20 of Payment of Wages Act as the accused petitioner contravened sections 4, 5, 7 and 25 of the Act but alike the provisions of IRO the Labour Court under the Payment of Wages Act, has not been given the same power as are</span> <span style="color: black;">vested in the Court of Magistrate, First Class under the Code of Criminal Procedure for the purpose of trying an offence and hence the Labour Court cannot take cognizance of the said offence and as such the proceeding is quashed. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span black;">PM August, Director Operations vs Chairman, First Labour Court 4 BLC 402</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p></div></div>

New Roman";	mso-bidi-theme-font:minor-bidi;}</style><![endif]--></p><p align="center" class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: center; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="font-size: 14pt; color: black;">Penal Code, 1860</span></strong></span></p><p align="center" class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: center; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; color: black;">[XLV of 1860]</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;"> </span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">2</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">A public servant by definition in 1982 in the Penal Code will prospectively be deemed to be a public servant under Act II of 1947 when he commits an offence as public servant after the amendment of the Penal Code. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">International Finance Investment and Commerce Bank Ltd vs Abdul Quayum and another 4 BLC (AD) 255.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 21 Clause 12</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">Although the petitioner as a Principal of a Private College gets 70% of his salary from the Government </span><span style="color: black;">exchequer by way of subsidy but it does not fall within the purview of Clause 12 of section 21 of the Penal Code as it cannot be said that the petitioner has been performing public duty acquiring a status of a public servant. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Matiur Rahman (Md) vs State, represented by the Deputy Commissioner 4 BLC 375.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Sections 21, 409, </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">477A</span></strong><span style="color: black;"> <strong>&amp; 462A</strong></span><strong><span style="color: black;">— </span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;"> </span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Section 110 of Banking Companies Act, 1991 also provides that a Manager, Officer and other functionaries of the Banking Company are deemed to be public servants under section 21 of the Penal Code and hence the appellant and the respondent are public servants and the case has been rightly instituted in the Court of Special Judge against the respondent. Moreso, section 5 of Act II of 1947 speaks of the offences as mentioned in the schedule of the Act to be tried by Special Judges and in the schedule there are sections 403 and 477A of the Penal Code with which the accused has been charged for committing misconduct as a public servant. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">International Finance Investment and Commerce Bank Ltd vs Abdul Quayum and another 4 BLC (AD) 255.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 34</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Although under section 34 of the Penal Code, when a criminal act is done by several persons, in furtherance of the common intention of all, each of such persons is liable for that act in the same manner as if it were done by him alone, in awarding punishment each of such persons may be sentenced to death if there is direct evidence of their criminal act in furtherance of the common intention of all. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Khalil Mia vs State 4 BLC, (AD) 223.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"> </strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 34</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">There is no evidence whatsoever from the side of the prosecution that the accused- appellants attacked Momdel Hossain to kill him, rather it appears that the presence of deceased Momdel at the place of occurrence is accidental one and as such the prosecution has failed to prove the ingredient of section 34 of the Penal Code. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Azharul Islam 3 BLC 382</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 34</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Under section 34 of the Penal Code, the essence of joint liability is to be found in the commonness of intention animating the accused in doing of criminal act in furtherance of such intention. The circumstances of this case patently show that the common intention of the four appellants was to cause the offence under section 325 read with 34 of the Penal Code and accordingly they are guilty under sections 325/34 instead of sections 302/34 of the Penal Code. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Kowsar 1 BLC 455</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Section 34</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Common intention is a state of mind which may develop in the course of the transaction constituting the offence and may be gathered from the number and nature of injuries inflicted on the person of the victim when in the instant case as many as 13 injuries most of which were grievous in nature were caused as a result of frontal attack can be said to be a result of pre­concert. Although the convict-appellant Badal had no pistol or any weapon in his hands, but in a different manner he also prevented the victim either from fleeing away or warding off the attack and facilitated the consequent infliction of injuries resulting in his death. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">AKM Ataur Rahman Khan alias Badal and another vs State 5 BLC 508.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><em><span style="color: black;"> </span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Sections 34, 109 &amp; 302</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">Under section 34 the two elements that constitute the crime are the common intention and the participation in the crime, while those in the case under section 149 are the common object and the participation in the unlawful assembly. Where the common object becomes equivalent to the common intention and where participation in the assembly is coupled with the participation in the crime then the two elements of both the constructive liabilities become the same. In such cases, no separate charge need be framed for each of them as laid down under section 233, CrPC and the conviction of the accused may be altered from one under sections 302/149 to that under sections 302/34 without there being a charge for the latter as provided under sections 236 and 237, CrPC. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">State vs Abdul Hye Miaji and others 1 BLC 125</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Sections<span style="mso-spacerun: yes;">   </span>34,<span style="mso-spacerun: yes;">   </span>302<span style="mso-spacerun: yes;">   </span>and<span style="mso-spacerun: yes;">   </span>324</span></strong><strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;"> </span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">In<strong><span style="mso-spacerun: yes;">   </span></strong></span><span style="color: black;">the</span> <span style="color: black;">absence of premeditated intention to kill, the injuries caused by the four accused persons are not being grievous in nature and the same has no contribution towards the cause of death for which they would not be guilty of the offence under section 302 of the Penal Code and accordingly, their conviction is altered from 302/34 of the Penal Code to that of under section 324 of the Penal Code and the sentence is reduced to the period already undergone. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;"> </span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Madris and others vs State 2 BLC 249</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Sections </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">57</span></strong><span style="color: black;"> <strong>and 302</strong></span><strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">Sentence</span></strong><span style="color: black;">— </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><span style="color: black;">Normal sentence under section 302 of the Penal Code is death but under some extenuating circumstances it may be</span> <span style="color: black;">imprisonment for life but such sentence can never be 30 years taking the aid of section 57 of the Code. </span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">Farid Ali vs State 4 BLC 27</span></em></strong><em><span style="color: black;">.</span></em></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Sections 96 and </span></strong><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><span style="color: black;">97</span></strong><strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;"> </span></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">As there is no evidence of any aggression from the side of victim and even if there was any threatening behaviour from the victim, the person threatened could have used only that much of force which was proportionate to repel the attack. In the instant case it was a one-sided affair for which the contention that the action of the convict-appellant was in exercise of the right of private defence either of his body or property or the body and the property of others cannot be accepted. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong style="mso-bidi-font-weight: normal;"><em><span style="color: black;">AKM Ataur Rahman Khan alias Badal and another vs State 5 BLC 508.</span></em></strong></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-size: 12pt; font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif;"><strong><span style="color: black;">Sections 96 and 302</span></strong><span style="color: black;">—</span></span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;">After separating the chaff of falsehood from the grains of truth it is found that the prosecution has failed to prove their case against Wali and Khalil and the convict Sayed exercised his right of private defence for which he is entitled to get the benefit of section 96 of the Penal Code and they are found not guilty of the charge of murder. </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt; text-align: justify; text-justify: inter-ideograph; line-height: normal; background: white; mso-layout-grid-align: none; text-autospace: none;"><span style="font-family: verdana, geneva, sans-serif; color: black;"> </span></p><p class="MsoNormal" style="margin-bottom: .0001pt;
